head.title: Sorrow and Shame At Joseph's Tomb

hedline.hl1: Sorrow and Shame At Joseph's Tomb

abstract.p: Zeigham Khokher letter on ransacking of Joseph's Tomb (Oct 8 article) hopes for day when Muslims and Jews recognize their shared humanity and defend the rights of all people

block.p: Re ''Palestinians Destroy Israeli Site That Was Scene of Many Clashes'' (news article, Oct. 8):

As a Muslim, I am ashamed and disgusted by the ransacking of Joseph's Tomb. Not only because we should respect each other's religious sensibilities, but because Joseph is a revered prophet to Muslims as well. I am sure that many Muslims share my sense of sorrow and horror at this event.
Re ''Palestinians Destroy Israeli Site That Was Scene of Many Clashes'' (news article, Oct. 8):

As a Muslim, I am ashamed and disgusted by the ransacking of Joseph's Tomb. Not only because we should respect each other's religious sensibilities, but because Joseph is a revered prophet to Muslims as well. I am sure that many Muslims share my sense of sorrow and horror at this event.
On the other hand, it should be clear to any reasonable person that the Israeli Army has not really been very gentle on the Palestinians.
Peaceful coexistence demands that all fair-minded people, Jews and Muslims, should recognize and distance themselves from the atrocities perpetrated by those within their own ranks.
I can only hope for a day when Muslims and Jews recognize their shared humanity and defend the rights of all people, regardless of faith.
